I\'ve had Kerbal Space Program for about....three weeks now, and i just now decided to get an account for this forum.

Any tips would be appreciated.

Welcome to the forums!

Happy Launching!

*Arrr*!

Cap\'n Cardgame 

(and nevermind the impostors)

For specific tips and other help, you\'ll want to check out the [How To](http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/forum/index.php?board=10.0) section. 

My broad advice is to keep your craft small and slowly increase their size if needed. Burn straight up to about 45,000 meters or slightly higher before pitching over if you want to achieve orbit. This lets you get out of the denser part of the atmosphere so you\'ll get further on less fuel.

Always keep an eye on your Nav Ball on the bottom center of the screen, it has many helpful icons. If you\'re not familiar with rocket terminology, learning the meanings of prograde and retrograde may help.

Welcome to the KSP Forums!

Happy Launching!

Arrr!

Capt\'n Skunky
